mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn106:3.11.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:3.11.en: Being confident, they either attain the imperturbable now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:4.6.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:4.6.en: Being confident, they either attain the imperturbable now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:5.9.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:5.9.en: Being confident, they either attain the imperturbable now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:6.11.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:6.11.en: Being confident, they either attain the dimension of nothingness now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:7.4.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:7.4.en: Being confident, they either attain the dimension of nothingness now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:8.4.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:8.4.en: Being confident, they either attain the dimension of nothingness now, or are freed by wisdom.

mn106:9.11.pli: Sampasāde sati etarahi vā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati.
mn106:9.11.en: Being confident, they either attain the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception now, or are freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 106
Conducive to the Imperturbable

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an9.44:1.1.en: “Reverend, they speak of a person called ‘freed by wisdom’.

an9.44:1.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, paññāvimutto vutto bhagavatā”ti?
an9.44:1.2.en: What is the one freed by wisdom that the Buddha spoke of?”

an9.44:2.3.pli: Ettāvatāpi kho, āvuso, paññāvimutto vutto bhagavatā pariyāyena …pe….
an9.44:2.3.en: To this extent the Buddha spoke of the one freed by wisdom in a qualified sense. …

an9.44:3.3.pli: Ettāvatāpi kho, āvuso, paññāvimutto vutto bhagavatā nippariyāyenā”ti.
an9.44:3.3.en: To this extent the Buddha spoke of the one freed by wisdom in a definitive sense.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9.44
5. Similarity
Freed by Wisdom

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn22.58:1.3.pli: Bhikkhupi, bhikkhave, paññāvimutto rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto paññāvimuttoti vuccati.
sn22.58:1.3.en: A mendicant freed by wisdom is also freed by not grasping, due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form. They’re called a mendicant freed by wisdom.

sn22.58:3.4.pli: Bhikkhupi, bhikkhave, paññāvimutto viññāṇassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto paññāvimuttoti vuccati.
sn22.58:3.4.en: A mendicant freed by wisdom is also freed by not grasping, due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding consciousness. They’re called a mendicant freed by wisdom.

sn22.58:4.1.pli: Tatra kho, bhikkhave, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṁ nānākaraṇaṁ, tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa paññāvimuttena bhikkhunā”ti?
sn22.58:4.1.en: What, then, is the difference between a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, and a mendicant freed by wisdom?”

sn22.58:5.3.pli: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, viseso, ayaṁ adhippayāso, idaṁ nānākaraṇaṁ tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa paññāvimuttena bhikkhunā”ti.
sn22.58:5.3.en: This is the difference between a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, and a mendicant freed by wisdom.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 22.58
6. Involvement
The Fully Awakened Buddha

dn33:2.3.44.pli: ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhi, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, dhammānusārī, saddhānusārī.
dn33:2.3.44.en: one freed both ways, one freed by wisdom, a direct witness, one attained to view, one freed by faith, a follower of teachings, and a follower by faith.

dn33:3.3.51.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn33:3.3.51.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

dn33:3.3.81.en: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?

dn33:3.3.85.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti.
dn33:3.3.85.en: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.20:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.20:2.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

an10.20:12.1.en: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?

an10.20:12.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti.
an10.20:12.3.en: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.20
2. A Protector
Abodes of the Noble Ones (2nd)

mn70:14.3.pli: Ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhi, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, dhammānusārī, saddhānusārī.
mn70:14.3.en: One freed both ways, one freed by wisdom, a direct witness, one attained to view, one freed by faith, a follower of teachings, and a follower by faith.

mn70:16.1.en: And what person is freed by wisdom?

mn70:16.3.en: This person is called freed by wisdom.

dn34:2.3.66.pli: idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn34:2.3.66.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

dn34:2.3.99.en: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?

dn34:2.3.105.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti.
dn34:2.3.105.en: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an7.56:8.1.pli: Idha pana, mārisa moggallāna, bhikkhu paññāvimutto hoti.
an7.56:8.1.en: Take a mendicant who is freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7.56
6. The Undeclared Points
Tissa the Divinity

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an2.48:1.6.pli: ‘asuko bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto, asuko paññāvimutto, asuko kāyasakkhī, asuko diṭṭhippatto, asuko saddhāvimutto, asuko dhammānusārī, asuko saddhānusārī, asuko sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo, asuko dussīlo pāpadhammo’ti.
an2.48:1.6.en: ‘The mendicant so-and-so is freed both ways; so-and-so is freed by wisdom; so-and-so is a direct witness; so-and-so is attained to view; so-and-so is freed by faith; so-and-so is a follower of teachings; so-and-so is a follower by faith; so-and-so is ethical, of good character; so-and-so is unethical, of bad character.’

an2.48:2.3.pli: ‘asuko bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto, asuko paññāvimutto, asuko kāyasakkhī, asuko diṭṭhippatto, asuko saddhāvimutto, asuko dhammānusārī, asuko saddhānusārī, asuko sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo, asuko dussīlo pāpadhammo’ti.
an2.48:2.3.en: ‘The mendicant so-and-so is freed both ways; so-and-so is freed by wisdom; so-and-so is a direct witness; so-and-so is attained to view; so-and-so is freed by faith; so-and-so is a follower of teachings; so-and-so is a follower by faith; so-and-so is ethical, of good character; so-and-so is unethical, of bad character.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 2.42–51
The Chapter on Assemblies

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn12.70:11.2.en: “Reverend Susīma, we are freed by wisdom.”

sn12.70:12.3.pli: “Ājāneyyāsi vā tvaṁ, āvuso susima, na vā tvaṁ ājāneyyāsi atha kho paññāvimuttā mayan”ti.
sn12.70:12.3.en: “Reverend Susīma, whether you understand or not, we are freed by wisdom.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 12.70
7. The Great Chapter
The Wanderer Susīma

mn65:11.6.en: Suppose I was to say the same thing to a mendicant who is freed by wisdom,

mn65:12.2.pli: api nu tvaṁ, bhaddāli, tasmiṁ samaye ubhatobhāgavimutto vā hosi paññāvimutto vā kāyasakkhi vā diṭṭhippatto vā saddhāvimutto vā dhammānusārī vā saddhānusārī vā”ti?
mn65:12.2.en: At that time were you freed both ways, freed by wisdom, a direct witness, attained to view, freed by faith, a follower of teachings, or a follower by faith?”

an7.14:1.3.pli: Ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhī, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, dhammānusārī, saddhānusārī.
an7.14:1.3.en: The one freed both ways, the one freed by wisdom, the direct witness, the one attained to view, the one freed by faith, the follower of teachings, and the follower by faith.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.16:1.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho, ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhī, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, saddhānusārī, dhammānusārī, gotrabhū—
an10.16:1.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; an Independent Buddha; one freed both ways; one freed by wisdom; a direct witness; one attained to view; one freed by faith; a follower by faith; a follower of teachings; a lamb of the flock.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.16
2. A Protector
Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.19:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.19:1.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, is endowed with six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has pure intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.19
2. A Protector
Abodes of the Noble Ones (1st)

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn8.7:4.4.pli: Imesañhi, sāriputta, pañcannaṁ bhikkhusatānaṁ saṭṭhi bhikkhū tevijjā, saṭṭhi bhikkhū chaḷabhiññā, saṭṭhi bhikkhū ubhatobhāgavimuttā, atha itare paññāvimuttā”ti.
sn8.7:4.4.en: For of these five hundred monks, sixty have the three knowledges, sixty have the six direct knowledges, sixty are freed both ways, and the rest are freed by wisdom.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 8.7
1. With Vaṅgīsa
The Invitation to Admonish

snp4.9:13.2.en: there are no delusions for one freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an8.22:8.2.pli: ‘asuko, gahapati, bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto asuko paññāvimutto asuko kāyasakkhī asuko diṭṭhippatto asuko saddhāvimutto asuko dhammānusārī asuko saddhānusārī asuko sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo asuko dussīlo pāpadhammo’ti.
an8.22:8.2.en: ‘Householder, that mendicant is freed both ways. That one is freed by wisdom. That one is a direct witness. That one is attained to view. That one is freed by faith. That one is a follower of teachings. That one is a follower by faith. That one is ethical, of good character. That one is unethical, of bad character.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 8.22
3. Householders
With Ugga of Elephant Village

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

dn15:34.10.pli: “Yato kho, ānanda, bhikkhu imāsañca sattannaṁ viññāṇaṭṭhitīnaṁ imesañca dvinnaṁ āyatanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādā vimutto hoti, ayaṁ vuccatānanda, bhikkhu paññāvimutto.
dn15:34.10.en: “When a mendicant, having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape regarding these seven planes of consciousness and these two dimensions, is freed by not grasping, they’re called a mendicant who is freed by wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 15
The Great Discourse on Causation

dn28:8.3.pli: Ubhatobhāgavimutto paññāvimutto kāyasakkhi diṭṭhippatto saddhāvimutto dhammānusārī saddhānusārī.
dn28:8.3.en: One freed both ways, one freed by wisdom, a direct witness, one attained to view, one freed by faith, a follower of teachings, a follower by faith.
